intro: Haplopappus apargioides, commonly known as the narrowhead ragwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it produces small, bristly seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Haplopappus apargioides is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed sites.
